schedule: Slot : PG-3A / LEC: MTh 11:00-12:00 REQ;T/D: T 11:00-12:00 REQ; LAB: MT 14:00-16:00 LAB;
title: ELECTRONICS
ENERGY
instructor_notes:
Course Outline: Energy in nature and society. Energy in the universe, the sun and the earth. Energy in the biosphere and human history. Our use of fossil fuels, its associated problems and the possible alternatives.

The evaluation will be through mid- and end-sem exams and a term paper followed by a presentation in front of the class and a viva voce.

You need to have a CPI > 6.66 for taking this course as an OE.

schedule: Slot : PG-11A / LEC: MTh 09:00-10:00 REQ;T 12:00-13:00 REQ;
title: PROBABILISTIC THEORY OF PATTERN RECOGNITION
instructor_notes:
Pre-req : MTH 311 Probability Theory - I or ESO 209 - Probability & Statistics, MTH 418 Inference - I OR Consent of the instructor.

Description : This course will present different methods of statistical pattern recognition for multivariate data, and use results from probability theory to study their asymptotic properties.
